§Problem solving

A strong model is something like:

  1. Define the problem
  2. Shape the strategy
  3. Probe the approach
  4. Do the work
  5. Learn from outcomes

Often, ideas are what become psychologically salient. But doing the above is likely to be tremendously useful!

Q. If you had to split problem-solving into 5 stages, what might those be? A. Define the problem, Shape the strategy, Probe the approach, Do the work, Learn from outcomes
